attributes.action: Stop denying the rights of Christians in Britain
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Christian couple will not be reregistered as foster carers and have to give up their foster son following their refusal to sign an Equality policy.

They have been fostering since 2001 and looked after 28 children.

Mr Matherick said he and his wife had never discriminated against anybody, but they would not teach children about the practice of homosexuality because the Bible condemns any kind of sexual practice outside of a marriage relationship.

The couple have now had to give up custody of their 11-year-old foster son. 

The couple would be required to discuss same-sex relationships with their child who is only 11, and tell them gay partnerships were as acceptable as heterosexual marriages.

Mr Matherick said: "I believe it is against the word of God.”

The couple said "They were saying that we had to be prepared to talk about sexuality with 11-year-olds, and to be prepared to explain how gay people date."

Mrs Matherick added: "We feel we are being discriminated against as Christians, and many others are finding themselves in our position."
